business.headline: Insured, but still deniedIn Part 2 of our series on India's insurance crisis, we explore why, for thousands of Indians, having a policy doesn't mean having protection when it matters most.

Jane Street to challenge Sebi trading ban, slams charges as inflammatory: ReportIn an internal email to staff over the weekend, the US-based firm said it was "beyond disappointed" by Sebi's accusations, which it described as "extremely inflammatory."

Have lost their tax edge: Expert sounds the alarm on ULIPsThe tax expert said ULIPs no longer guarantee tax-free returns. Investors paying over Rs 2.5 lakh annually may face capital gains tax—making mutual funds a more efficient alternative.
Sensex opens 65 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; Kotak Bank up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 72.04 points to 83,514.54, while the NSE Nifty50 added 16.50 points to 25,477.80 as of 9:40 am.

Market opening: How will Sensex, Nifty react to Trump's tariff announcement?While a US-India trade deal may help improve mood, the benefits may be limited to specific sectors. For today's session, Nifty to find support between 25,330 and 25,180 and face resistance near 25,510 and 25,630, say experts.

Trump's tariff list: 14 countries, new rates, and what they export to AmericaUS President Donald Trump confirmed that letters had been sent to several nations, warning them that if new trade agreements are not reached by August 1, increased import duties will be implemented.

Necktie Nomics: Can the RBI Governor's tie colour predict rate moves?An SBI report looked at the ties worn by the RBI Governor during Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) meetings. Instead of only watching inflation numbers or GDP data, they turned their attention to the shades of silk draped around the Governor's neck.
Sensex ends flat, Nifty below 25,500; HUL gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex closed 9.61 points higher at 83,442.50, while the NSE Nifty remained flat to end below 25,500.
GCCs push India's office leasing to new heights: ReportGCCs are no longer coming to India just for cheaper costs. They now see India as a strong base for talent, innovation and large modern offices.

Sebi to intensify watch on derivatives trading after Jane Street episodeIndia is currently the world's largest equity derivatives market. According to the Futures Industry Association, it accounted for nearly 60% of the derivatives contracts traded globally in April.

EMIs hurt India's middle class more than inflation, says financial expertToday, almost everything is available on easy monthly instalments, from a new phone to flight tickets, even groceries. What was once a helpful option has now turned into a lifestyle. However, this is silently eating into people's income, leaving little room for savings or emergencies.

Filing ITR for the first time? 7 common errors new taxpayers must avoidFiling your ITR is not enough. You must verify it too. If you forget, the tax department treats it as if you never filed it at all. You can e-verify using Aadhaar OTP, net banking, or by sending a signed physical copy. Without verification, your return stays incomplete.

entertainment.headline: Unni Mukundan's Instagram hacked, actor warns against suspicious activityMalayalam actor Unni Mukundan has warned his fans that his official Instagram account has been hacked and urged caution against interacting with any messages from it. He is actively working with relevant teams to regain control and promises to update followers only through verified channels.

When it rains in Bollywood... magic unfolds and stories transformBollywood filmmakers have long used rain not just as a backdrop, but as a powerful emotional tool, a silent character that enhances love, heartbreak, transformation, and nostalgia. From 'Metro... In Dino' to 'Jab We Met', these iconic rain moments continue to stir hearts and shape stories.

Nick Jonas calls Priyanka Chopra saint, shares parenting lessonsNick Jonas recently opened up about fatherhood and called wife Priyanka Chopra a 'saint' while sharing parenting lessons. He praised Priyanka as an amazing partner who makes his journey as a father even more special.

Scarlett Johansson becomes highest grossing actor, beats Robert Downey JrActor Scarlett Johansson has set a new global box office record as the highest-grossing lead actor. Her milestone post-'Jurassic World Rebirth' propelled her past fellow MCU stars.

Akshay-Twinkle enjoy lakeside picnic with children Aarav and Nitara. WatchTwinkle Khanna and Akshay Kumar stepped out for a picnic together with their children Nitara and Aarav. The former actor shared a video, giving a glimpse of their family time.

Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi is back. But, who asked for it? 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' may have once stood as a symbol of family values, teaching the audience what an ideal woman should look like, but it doesn't sound relevant today. Nostalgia may be powerful, but it shouldn't come at the cost of progress. Women are chasing dreams beyond the kitchen. Do you believe that bringing back Tulsi is a step forward in storytelling?

Saiyaara trailer: Ahaan Panday, Aneet Padda promise an imperfectly perfect love storyThe official trailer for 'Saiyaara', featuring newcomers Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, is now out. The trailer teases an epic love story, elevated by a background score that adds impact to every moment.

Telugu lyricist Siva Shakti Datta, father of Oscar winner MM Keeravani, dies at 92Veteran lyricist Siva Shakthi Datta, father of Oscar-award-winning composer MM Keeravani, died on Monday night at his residence in Hyderabad. He was 92 years old.

Exclusive: Soundarya Sharma is manifesting an action film with Shah Rukh KhanActor Soundarya Sharma shared her aspirations to work in rom-coms and action films, expressing a strong desire to collaborate with Shah Rukh Khan and other renowned directors. She credited SRK's journey for inspiring her own dreams and looks forward to expanding her career with diverse and meaningful projects.

Alice in Borderland Season 3 gets a release date. Arisu, Usagi return to surviveThe much-awaited third season of the Japanese survival thriller 'Alice in Borderland' is set to premiere on Netflix globally in September this year. The makers announced the release date with a brand-new teaser poster.

Ajay Devgn meets Revanth Reddy, proposes world-class film studio in TelanganaActor Ajay Devgn met Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy on Monday. In his meeting with the Chief Minister, he proposed the possibility of a world-class film studio in the state.

Salman Khan exudes style in new pic amid Battle of Galwan buzz, fans reactSalman Khan impressed fans with a new photo amid buzz of his next highly anticipated film 'The Galwan Battle'. The story is based on one of India's most brutal battles fought without a single bullet being fired.

Metro In Dino box office Day 4: Basu's film dips on Monday after weekend boostAnurag Basu's 'Metro In Dino', is maintaining momentum at the box office. In just four days, the romantic drama has earned Rs 19.25 crore.

Priyanka Chopra meets Salman Khan's sister Arpita, says our girls are such bestiesActor Priyanka Chopra, who is basking in the success of 'Heads of State', met her friend Arpita Khan on Monday. She shared a video of their daughters, Malti Marie and Ayat, walking hand-in-hand on her Instagram story.

Mira Rajput calls Shahid Kapoor her forever in warm, fuzzy 10th anniversary postShahid Kapoor and wife Mira Rajput have completed a decade of togetherness. On the special occasion, the actor's wife shared pictures of the couple, which are sure to melt your hearts.

Rashmika reacts to Vijay Deverakonda's Kingdom promo: Let's prep for celebrationActor Rashmika Mandanna reacted to a promo of actor Vijay Deverakonda's much-anticipated film 'Kingdom'. The film is slated for a theatrical release worldwide on July 31.

3BHK: Moving portrait of dreams, dignity and family strength that endures'3BHK' tells the story of a middle-class family navigating life's hardships while dreaming of owning a home. The film stands out for its authentic portrayal and strong performances by Siddharth and Sarathkumar.

Boney Kapoor on Anshula's engagement: Your mother's strength lives on in youBoney Kapoor shared an emotional note after his daughter Anshula Kapoor announced her engagement with Rohan Thakkar. In his post on X, the veteran producer blessed the two and expressed his excitement to meet them soon.

Vijay Deverakonda removes 'The' tag after massive trolling: My name is enoughIn 2022, actor Vijay Deverakonda was criticised and trolled for adding 'The' as a tag to his name during the release of 'Liger'. In a recent interview, he opened up about the incident and why he has now decided to drop all tags.

general news.headline: Nitish Kumar announces 35% reservation for women in all Bihar government jobsAhead of the Assembly polls, Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar announced a 35% reservation for local women in all state government jobs and approved the formation of a new Bihar Youth Commission.

Congress chief mispronounces President's name as 'Murma', invites BJP fireMallikarjun Kharge, speaking in Chhattisgarh, could be heard referring to the President as 'Murma ji'. Seconds later, he did a gaffe again, mispronouncing 'Kovind' as 'Covid'.

Raj Thackeray's party workers detained, Fadnavis says rally didn't follow routeThe Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) took out a rally to counter a protest staged by traders in Thane over the assault of a food stall owner for not speaking Marathi.

Do you know who my dad is? I'll buy you: MNS leader's son 'threatened' influencerSocial media influencer Rajshree More claimed that Rahil Shaikh kept repeating that his father's name was Javed Shaikh throughout the confrontation. "Do you know who my father is? Who are you? I can buy you. How much money do you want?" she claimed Rahil said to her.

Virat Kohli's Wimbledon trip a problem? Let him watch, without being watchedVirat Kohli watching Wimbledon at the iconic Centre Court on Monday has upset a few. The former India captain was rooting for Novak Djokovic in his fourth-round match. Can't Kohli even watch tennis now?

Tamil Nadu temple guard died in police custody, confirms High Court probeA judicial inquiry initiated by the Madras High Court has confirmed that temple guard Ajith Kumar died in police custody. The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) may name more officers in the case.

Un-bee-lievable: Swarm of bees disrupt IndiGo Surat-Jaipur flight by an hourThe flight was ready for departure with all passengers and luggage on board when thousands of bees suddenly swarmed the aircraft's luggage door.

How Indian rail is pushing beyond Chicken's Neck, one capital at a timeSixty years after Assam's Guwahati was linked by rail, Mizoram's Aizawl is the latest Northeast capital ready to join the network, beyond the strategic Shillong Corridor or Chicken's Neck. With state-of-the-art bridges in Seismic Zone V and kilometre-long tunnels, the Indian Railways has connected Aizawl, after linking Itanagar and Agartala.
Insured, but still deniedIn Part 2 of our series on India's insurance crisis, we explore why, for thousands of Indians, having a policy doesn't mean having protection when it matters most.

Mastermind who plotted Patna businessman's murder a trader, arrestedA trader identified as Ashok Saw has been arrested for masterminding Patna businessman Gopal Khemka's murder, for which a Rs 10 lakh contract was given.

Close to making deal with India: Trump after tariff letters to 14 countriesSpeaking during a dinner with Israeli PM Netanyahu, Donald Trump noted that countries unwilling to agree will receive tariff notices. Trump added some may get adjustments if they have valid reasons, stressing fairness in negotiations.

Lord's pitch chatter: Shubman Gill's subtle dig and England's growing headacheEngland vs India, 3rd Test: On a Birmingham featherbed that suits their style, England were outplayed comfortably by Shubman Gill's India. Ahead of the third Test in London, there is speculation that England might resort to a more lively pitch. But, can they afford the extra spice at Lord's?

Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi is back. But, who asked for it? 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' may have once stood as a symbol of family values, teaching the audience what an ideal woman should look like, but it doesn't sound relevant today. Nostalgia may be powerful, but it shouldn't come at the cost of progress. Women are chasing dreams beyond the kitchen. Do you believe that bringing back Tulsi is a step forward in storytelling?

Karnataka man takes 'possessed' mother for exorcism, she is beaten to deathA 45-year-old woman in Karnataka's Shivamogga district was fatally assaulted for six hours during a supposed exorcism. Police have arrested the victim's son and the woman who led the ritual.

MNS leader's son quizzed for 6 hours, says he consumed alcohol before joyrideRahil Javed Shaikh admitted to drinking heavily at a friend's house on Sunday before his mother called and asked him to come home. In a drunken state, he hit Rajshree's car in Mumbai's Lokhandwala and then misbehaved with her.

Novak Djokovic breaks 'Roger Federer curse' to reach 16th Wimbledon quarterfinalWimbledon 2025: Novak Djokovic came back from a set down to beat 11th seed Alex de Minaur on Monday. Roger Federer watched the Serb's win from the Royal Box on Center Court.

Why Rashmika Mandanna's 'first Kodava actor' claim has angered her communityActor Rashmika Mandanna, in a recent interview, called herself the first Kodava actor. Her claim has angered the artistes who had entered the film industry before her.

Canva is down for many users worldwide, company working on a fixCanva users faced issues with saving and viewing designs on Tuesday morning. The company acknowledged the outage and says a fix is on the way. At the time of writing, things appear stable.

China denies backing Pakistan in Op Sindoor, urges strengthening ties with IndiaChina downplayed the Indian Army's claims of Beijing aiding Pakistan during Operation Sindoor, reiterating its ties with Islamabad are not aimed at any third party.
Dramatic timelapse video shows floodwater swallowing Texas bridge in minutesThe 30-minute footage, filmed by an eyewitness, reveals rising waters submerging the elevated road in just 10 minutes.

No aam moment in Lucknow as people rush to loot mangoes at event. Video goes viralAt the Lucknow Aam Mahotsav, visitors rushed to the display area, grabbing plates of mangoes meant solely for exhibition, leading to scenes of utter disorder.

Patna businessman's murder accused killed in encounter during arrest attemptPolice recovered a pistol and cartridges after Vikas alias Raja, who allegedly supplied the weapon for businessman Gopal Khemka's murder and had links to shooter Umesh, was killed during an encounter.

Bharat bandh: 25 crore workers to go on strike; banks, transport to be hitWorkers from various sectors including banking, insurance, postal services, and coal mining are expected to participate in the Bharat Bandh strike.

Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj to contest all seats, sets up three-way Bihar fightIn the first-ever meeting of its national executive committee, Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj Party decided that the candidates would be announced in phases, spread across 4–5 rounds.

Unni Mukundan's Instagram hacked, actor warns against suspicious activityMalayalam actor Unni Mukundan has warned his fans that his official Instagram account has been hacked and urged caution against interacting with any messages from it. He is actively working with relevant teams to regain control and promises to update followers only through verified channels.

When it rains in Bollywood... magic unfolds and stories transformBollywood filmmakers have long used rain not just as a backdrop, but as a powerful emotional tool, a silent character that enhances love, heartbreak, transformation, and nostalgia. From 'Metro... In Dino' to 'Jab We Met', these iconic rain moments continue to stir hearts and shape stories.

Nick Jonas calls Priyanka Chopra saint, shares parenting lessonsNick Jonas recently opened up about fatherhood and called wife Priyanka Chopra a 'saint' while sharing parenting lessons. He praised Priyanka as an amazing partner who makes his journey as a father even more special.

Scarlett Johansson becomes highest grossing actor, beats Robert Downey JrActor Scarlett Johansson has set a new global box office record as the highest-grossing lead actor. Her milestone post-'Jurassic World Rebirth' propelled her past fellow MCU stars.

sports.headline: Lord's Test vs India will be Ben Stokes' toughest challenge as captain: AthertonMichael Atherton believes the Lord's Test will be a stern challenge for Ben Stokes' England captaincy after the heavy Edgbaston defeat. The upcoming match will be a test of Stokes' leadership and resilience, according to Atherton.

Virat Kohli's Wimbledon trip a problem? Let him watch, without being watchedVirat Kohli watching Wimbledon at the iconic Centre Court on Monday has upset a few. The former India captain was rooting for Novak Djokovic in his fourth-round match. Can't Kohli even watch tennis now?

Extraordinary Luka Modric is coming to AC Milan: New manager Massimiliano AllegriAC Milan boss Massimiliano Allegri has confirmed that Luka Modric will join the club after the end of the FIFA World Cup this month. Modric is set to leave Real Madrid after a successful 13 years with the club.

Was Akash Deep's delivery to Joe Root a no-ball? MCC settles debateThe Marylebone Cricket Club (MCC), the England-based governing body responsible for cricket laws, has confirmed that Akash Deep's delivery, which dismissed Joe Root in the second Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy Test, was legal.

Too early to judge Sam Konstas' Test career: Australia coach Andrew McDonaldAustralia coach Andrew McDonald said that it was too early to judge the Test career of Sam Konstas after his rough time during the ongoing Test series against the West Indies. McDonald also said that they will keep a close eye on the domestic performances heading into the Ashes series.

Phenomenal Pant follows his instincts: Delhi coach decodes India's X factorFormer India cricketer and selector Sarandeep Singh has been left in awe of Rishabh Pant's electrifying strokeplay in the ongoing Test series against England. The Delhi coach hailed the wicketkeeper batter for his strong resolve and fearlessness.

Day 9 schedule: Aryna Sabalenka, Carlos Alcaraz headline quarterfinalistsThe quarterfinals of Wimbledon get underway on Day Nine of the Championships at the All England Lawn Tennis and Croquet Club in London. In the men's singles, fifth seed Taylor Fritz faces Karen Khachanov, while Carlos Alcaraz takes on home favourite Cameron Norrie in a blockbuster clash on Centre Court.

England must play Jofra Archer at Lord's, says James AndersonEngland vs India, 3rd Test: England great James Anderson has called for the immediate inclusion of Jofra Archer in the playing XI for the crucial third Test against India at Lord's.

Lord's pitch chatter: Shubman Gill's subtle dig and England's growing headacheEngland vs India, 3rd Test: On a Birmingham featherbed that suits their style, England were outplayed comfortably by Shubman Gill's India. Ahead of the third Test in London, there is speculation that England might resort to a more lively pitch. But, can they afford the extra spice at Lord's?

Watch: Sinner carries injured Dimitrov's bags off court after retirementJannik Sinner showed pure class on Monday at Wimbledon, carrying Grigor Dimitrov's bags off the court after the Bulgarian was forced to retire mid-match due to injury.

Kane Williamson unavailable as New Zealand name squad for Zimbabwe TestsSenior batter Kane Williamson remains unavailable as New Zealand named their squad for the upcoming two-match Test series against Zimbabwe in Bulawayo.

Day 9 schedule: Aryna Sabalenka, Carlos Alcaraz headline quarterfinalistsThe quarterfinals of Wimbledon get underway on Day Nine of the Championships at the All England Lawn Tennis and Croquet Club in London. In the men's singles, fifth seed Taylor Fritz faces Karen Khachanov, while Carlos Alcaraz takes on home favourite Cameron Norrie in a blockbuster clash on Centre Court.

England must play Jofra Archer at Lord's, says James AndersonEngland vs India, 3rd Test: England great James Anderson has called for the immediate inclusion of Jofra Archer in the playing XI for the crucial third Test against India at Lord's.

Lord's pitch chatter: Shubman Gill's subtle dig and England's growing headacheEngland vs India, 3rd Test: On a Birmingham featherbed that suits their style, England were outplayed comfortably by Shubman Gill's India. Ahead of the third Test in London, there is speculation that England might resort to a more lively pitch. But, can they afford the extra spice at Lord's?

Watch: Sinner carries injured Dimitrov's bags off court after retirementJannik Sinner showed pure class on Monday at Wimbledon, carrying Grigor Dimitrov's bags off the court after the Bulgarian was forced to retire mid-match due to injury.

Kane Williamson unavailable as New Zealand name squad for Zimbabwe TestsSenior batter Kane Williamson remains unavailable as New Zealand named their squad for the upcoming two-match Test series against Zimbabwe in Bulawayo.

Jannik Sinner escapes upset as Grigor Dimitrov's injury sends him to quarterfinalsJannik Sinner was given a major reprieve during his fourth-round clash at Wimbledon as Grigor Dimitrov's unfortunate pectoral injury handed him a walkover despite being two sets down in the match.

Wimbledon 2025: Ben Shelton defeats Lorenzo Sonego, Mira Andreeva thumps NavarroBen Shelton came out victorious in a hard-fought win over Italy's Lorenzo Sonego in the fourth round, while Mira Andreeva put up a dominant display to join Maria Sharapova as the youngest to progress through to the quarterfinals of Wimbledon.

Gill halfway through to being India's next batting great: Karsan GhavriThe former India cricketer, Karsan Ghavri has gone on to back Shubman Gill, already being on track to be India's next big batting great, following the path of legendary names like Sunil Gavaskar and Sachin Tendulkar. This comes after his sensational performance against England in the Birmingham Test.

Virat Kohli, Anushka Sharma attend Wimbledon, watch gladiator Djokovic in actionStar India batter Virat Kohli was in attendance with his Bollywood actor wife Anushka Sharma to watch Novak Djokovic's fourth-round fixture against Alex de Minaur. Djokovic beat his Australian rival 1-6, 6-4, 6-4, 6-4 to progress ahead in the tournament.

Novak Djokovic breaks 'Roger Federer curse' to reach 16th Wimbledon quarterfinalWimbledon 2025: Novak Djokovic came back from a set down to beat 11th seed Alex de Minaur on Monday. Roger Federer watched the Serb's win from the Royal Box on Center Court.

Nothing should be said about Gambhir: Yograj after India's 2nd Test winYograj Singh believes that Gautam Gambhir has copped a lot of unfair criticism with regards to the Test team, and the head coach should be appreciated instead for giving back to the game that made their careers.

RCB's Yash Dayal faces sexual harassment case after woman alleges exploitationAn FIR has been registered against Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) fast bowler Yash Dayal for sexually exploiting a woman on the pretext of marriage. According to the complaint, the woman alleged that she was in a five-year relationship with Dayal, during which he mentally, physically, and financially exploited her under the false promise of marriage.

Brian Lara deserves to keep the record: Wiaan Mulder on declaring before 400South Africa all-rounder Wiaan Mulder revealed the reason behind not going after Brian Lara's record for the highest individual score in Tests and said that he declared on 367 out of respect for the legendary batter.

Novak Djokovic breaks 'Roger Federer curse' to reach 16th Wimbledon quarterfinalWimbledon 2025: Novak Djokovic came back from a set down to beat 11th seed Alex de Minaur on Monday. Roger Federer watched the Serb's win from the Royal Box on Center Court.

Nothing should be said about Gambhir: Yograj after India's 2nd Test winYograj Singh believes that Gautam Gambhir has copped a lot of unfair criticism with regards to the Test team, and the head coach should be appreciated instead for giving back to the game that made their careers.

RCB's Yash Dayal faces sexual harassment case after woman alleges exploitationAn FIR has been registered against Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) fast bowler Yash Dayal for sexually exploiting a woman on the pretext of marriage. According to the complaint, the woman alleged that she was in a five-year relationship with Dayal, during which he mentally, physically, and financially exploited her under the false promise of marriage.

Brian Lara deserves to keep the record: Wiaan Mulder on declaring before 400South Africa all-rounder Wiaan Mulder revealed the reason behind not going after Brian Lara's record for the highest individual score in Tests and said that he declared on 367 out of respect for the legendary batter.

Gill has taken captaincy, number four role like a duck to water: Mark ButcherENG vs IND: The former England cricketer, Mark Butcher, thinks that Shubman Gill has only gotten better since his appointment as Test captain alongside his batting role at number four during the England tour.

Jofra Archer's ready to go: McCullum on pacer's availability for 3rd TestEngland head coach Brendon McCullum recently revealed that fast bowler Jofra Archer is eager to play in the third Test against India at Lord's, London.

Video: Roger Federer watches Novak Djokovic in action from Wimbledon Royal BoxEight-time champion Roger Federer was accompanied by his wife Mirka to the Royal Box at Center Court. The Swiss great was there to watch Novak Djokovic's fourth-round match against Alex de Minaur on Monday, July 7.

Sai Kishore set to play two games for Surrey in County Championship 2025Tamil Nadu and Gujarat Titans (GT) spinner R Sai Kishore has been signed by Surrey to play in the County Championship 2025. The left-arm spinner has scalped 192 wickets from 46 first class matches.

Why did Wiaan Mulder declare on 367, 33 runs short of Brian Lara's Test record?South Africa vs Zimbabwe, 2nd Test: Wiaan Mulder declared when batting on 367 on Day 2 of the second Test against Zimbabwe in Bulawayo. The stand-in captain had the opportunity to break Brian Lara's all-time record, but chose against it.

We ran second for 5 days: McCullum reflects on crucial toss errorEngland head coach Brendon McCullum admitted that they were left chasing India for the majority of the second Test at Edgbaston in Birmingham after their blunder at the toss.

Prithvi Shaw explains move to Maharashtra after parting ways with MumbaiPrithvi Shaw has moved from Mumbai to Maharashtra for the upcoming domestic season. The out-of-favour India opener hopes the move will rejuvenate his career. Shaw last played for India in 2021.

Wimbledon Day 8 Highlights: Sinner gets a walkover after injury ends Dimitrov's dreamWimbledon 2025 Day 8 Live Updates: Novak Djokovic reaches the quarterfinal of Wimbledon for the 16th time in his career. The Serb defeated Alex de Minaur in four sets.  Earlier in the day, 23-year-old Flavio Cobolli ousted Marin Cilic to reach the quarterfinals of a Grand Slam for the first time in his career.

Wiian Mulder hits 2nd fastest triple hundred in Test cricket historyWiian Mulder became the first ever captain to score a triple hundred in Test cricket. His 297-ball innings is the second fastest, just behind Virender Sehwag's record.

F1: Oscar Piastri brake-checks himself out of victory in British Grand PrixLando Norris claimed a dramatic win at Silverstone after Oscar Piastri brake-checked himself into a second place finish at the British Grand Prix. Nico Hulkenberg secured his first-ever podium in a rain-hit, chaotic race.

Pat Cummins backs Sam Konstas despite inconsistent Test formAustralian captain Pat Cummins has backed young batter Sam Konstas despite his inconsistent Test performances. Cummins highlights the importance of patience and faith in emerging players during challenging phases.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
